definitions.definition: a device for measuring and showing time, usually found in or on a building and not worn by a person:
examples: We have an antique clock on our mantelpiece.

definitions.definition: to change the time on your clocks to an hour earlier, at an officially chosen time of year:
examples: Don't forget to turn the clocks back tonight.

definitions.definition: to change the time on your clocks to an hour later, at an officially chosen time of year
to take a particular time exactly to do or complete something:
examples: He clocked ten seconds in the 100 metres (= he ran it in ten seconds).
